description: Change of use of motorcycle show sales units 318, 320 and 312(Class Sui Generis) to Retail (Class A1). Demolition of the existing ground and first floor rear extensions, ancillary buildings and the 1.5 storey workshop to the side and rear of unit 318 and 320 Ewell Road. Erection of a single, two and three storey extension to the eastern side and rear of the existing building unit 318 and 320 and further internal alterations. Erection of two semi-detached properties to the rear of the site to accommodate 2x retail and 9 residential units with provision of 6 parking spaces and 16 cycle stores.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

A sample of the facing materials to be utilised in the development hereby permitted shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works above ground level on site are commenced. The development shall then be built in accordance with these approved samples.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No development shall take place (including any works of demolition) until a construction management plan or construction method statement has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved plan/statement shall be adhered to throughout the construction period. The statement shall provide for:How the proposed development will be built;Hours of working (which shall be limited to 08.00 to 18.00 Mondays to Fridays and between 08.00 to 13.00 on Saturdays and not at all on Bank Holidays and Sundays);The procedure for loading/unloading materials;The route to and away from site for muck away and vehicles with materials;The protocol for managing deliveries to one vehicle at a time on sites with restricted access or space;The protocol for managing vehicles that need to wait for access to the site; Whether any reversing manoeuvres are required onto or off the public highway into the site and whether a banksman will be provided;Temporary site access;Signing system for works traffic;Whether site access warning signs will be required in adjacent roads;Whether it is anticipated that statutory undertaker connections will be required into the site;The storage of plant, materials and operatives vehicles;The potential for impacts from dust and emissions during the demolition and/or construction phase upon local air quality and surrounding residents;Measures for the laying of dust, suppression of noise and abatement of other nuisance arising from development works;The location of all ancillary site buildings;The means of enclosure of the site, its erection and maintenance;Wheel washing equipment;The parking of vehicles of site operatives and visitors.Meeting the requirements of the Low Emission Zone for Non-Road Mobile Machinery (where relevant plant or vehicles are being used)Deliveries/collections to and from the site shall use a route that is agreed with the NRSWA team and the agreed route shall be signed accordingly.Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.These details are required prior to commencement of development because: the relevant works would take place at the beginning of the construction phase.

By the time the development hereby permitted is substantially complete, pedestrian/vehicular intervisibility splays of 2.8m x 3.3m shall have been provided in each direction where the access meets the back edge of footway, and shall be permanently retained free from any obstruction to visibility higher than 1.0m above ground level.Reason: In the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The car parking, servicing and manoeuvring areas shown on the approved drawing shall be provided with a hard, bound, dust-free surface, adequately drained before the development is occupied for the purpose hereby permitted. The respective areas shall be kept free from obstruction at all times, and shall not thereafter be used for any other purposes other than those shown on the approved drawings.Reason: To ensure the provision of adequate off-street parking in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

One car parking space shall be provided with active provision for electric vehicle charging points and one further space shall be provided with passive charging points.Reason: To ensure the provision of adequate off-street parking in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, a car park management plan (detailing how the use of the car park will be controlled and the signage necessary to direct pedestrians and vehicles) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall then be carried out in strict accordance with the approved plan.Reason: To ensure the provision of adequate off-street parking in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Any redundant accesses to the site shall be stopped up and the footway reinstated to the satisfaction of the local planning authority prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates.Reason: To ensure proper vehicular access to the site in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies 6.3 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS6 and DM8 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Cycle parking facilities shall be provided prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted in accordance with details which shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to that date, such facilities to be permanently retained at the site. Reason: To ensure that appropriate opportunities to promote sustainable transport are taken up, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS6 and DM8 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

No development shall commence until a landscaping scheme, including (where applicable) the retention of the existing trees, shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The approved scheme shall be implemented within the first planting season following completion of the development and the tree planting and landscaping shall thereafter be maintained for five years to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or shrubs which die during this period shall be replaced in the first available planting season, and the area shown to be landscaped shall be permanently retained for that purpose only.Reason: In the interests of visual amenity and also that the Local Planning Authority shall be satisfied as to the details of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Refuse storage facilities and recycling facilities shall be provided prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted in accordance with details which shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to that date, such facilities to be permanently retained at the site. The developer and/or their successors in title shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that all refuse and recyclable materials associated with the development shall either be stored within this dedicated store/area as shown on the approved plans, or internally within the building(s) that form part of the application site, and that no refuse or recycling material shall be stored or placed for collection on the public highway or pavement, except on the day of collection.Reason: To ensure proper waste management in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies 5.17 and 7.4 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Within 3 months of first occupation, evidence must be submitted to the Council confirming that the new dwelling hereby permitted has achieved no less than the C02 reductions (ENE1), internal water usage (WAT1) standards equivalent to Code for Sustainable Homes Level 4.  Evidence requirements are detailed in the "Schedule of Evidence Required for Post Construction Stage from ENE1 and WAT1 of the Code for Sustainable Homes Guide.  Evidence to demonstrate a 19% reduction compared to 2013 Part L regulations and internal water usage rates of 105L/day must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority, unless otherwise agreed in writing.Reason:  In order to ensure that all development is designed and built to make the most efficient use of resources, reduce its lifecycle impact on the environment and contributes to climate change mitigation and adaptation in accordance with Policy CS1 (Climate Change Mitigation) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

A scheme of noise insulation/reduction shall be submitted to ensure that the noise level of 35 dBLAeq,16 hour  in living rooms and bedrooms during the daytime (0700 to 2300 hours) and 30 dBLAeq,8 hour  and 45 dBLAmax during the night time (measured with F time-weighting and between 2300 and 0700 hours) in bedrooms in accordance with BS8233:2014 shall not be exceeded (applicable to those rooms overlooking Ewell Road only).  Where these levels cannot be met with windows open appropriate acoustic ventilation should be provided so that the room can be sufficiently ventilated.  The acoustic performance of any passive vent, variable speed mechanical air supply unit or whole house ventilation must be sufficient to ensure that the noise level standards given above are not compromised.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for occupants of the development, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

No development shall take place (including any works of demolition) until a contaminated land assessment and associated remediation strategy based on a Phase 2 intrusive investigation, focused on the areas of concern highlighted in the Phase 1 Report, has been submitted to and agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.Any remediation works identified in the contaminated land assessment shall be completed on site, in accordance with a quality assurance scheme agreed as part of that assessment.On completion of any agreed remediation works, a closure report and certificate of compliance shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for occupants of the development, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the commencement of any relevant work, a scheme for the screening of the terrace/balcony areas of the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The measures contained in the approved scheme shall then be implemented in full prior to the beneficial occupation of the development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, any windows or rooflights at first floor level or above in the eastern (rear) elevation of the semi-detached dwellings shall be constructed so that no part of the framework less than 1.7m above finished floor level shall be openable. Any part below that level shall be fitted with, and retained in, obscure glazing to a minimum of level 3 on the standard scale. Any film used to achieve the requisite obscurity level shall be non-perishable and tamper-proof, and shall be replaced immediately in the event that it ceases to result in obscurity to level 3. Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, the privacy louvres as shown on the approved plans shall be installed and the louvres shall be permanently retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any Order revoking and reenacting that Order with or without modification), no windows or other openings (other than those expressly authorised by this permission) shall be inserted at first floor level or above in either the extensions or the semi-detached dwellings to which this permission relates unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
A1 - Loading

When undertaking demolition and/or noisy building work, please be considerate to your neighbours and do not undertake work before 8am or after 6pm Monday to Friday, before 8am or after 1pm on a Saturday or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details for condition 57 (Dust Management Plan) of planning permission 20/02495/FUL have been assessed and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details for condition 53  (Water re-use/harvesting) of planning permission 20/02495/FUL have been assessed and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details.

The assessment has been based on the original layout of the house that shows a staggered rear elevation. The proposed extension would extend beyond the side elevation and would have a width greater than half the width of the original dwellinghouse, in conflict with Schedule 2, Part 1 Class A.1 (j) (iii) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

SiteThe application site is a two-storey mid-terrace dwellinghouse located on Muybridge Road. The site is not subject to any particular designations or environmental constraints.Relevant History 21/04119/PAEXT - Erection of single storey rear extension (6.00m in depth, maximum height of 3.06m and eaves height of 2.99m). Prior Approval Not Required on 03 Mar 2022. With conditions.Consultations7 neighbouring properties have been notified of the proposals and no representations were received.ConsiderationThe key areas of assessment are: The impact of the development on character and appearance. The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings.When read together Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area.Officers Comments: The application proposes the construction of a single storey front extension to facilitate a porch, as well as a single storey outbuilding to the rear of the site. These two elements are considered to be acceptable in terms of scale, form, bulk, height, massing, spacing and design. The application also proposes the installation of cladding on the front and rear elevations of the dwellinghouse. Whilst this would be an uncharacteristic choice of materials for the streetscene, Officers consider that this element of the proposal would not adversely impact the character of the dwellinghouse, by improving on the current situation. It is considered that there would be no adverse impacts on the character or appearance of the area as a result of the proposed development.Policy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) requires proposal to have regard to the amenities of the future occupants of the development as well as those of the existing occupants of neighbouring land and buildings, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance.Officers Comments: It is considered that the proposed development would not adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of overbearing appearance, loss of light or loss of privacy.In conclusion, the proposed development would be in general accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), the National Planning Practice Guidance, the London Plan (2021), Policies of the Core Strategy (2012) and the Residential Design SPD (2013).

Representations:Three surrounding owner/occupiers were notified of the proposals.  One letter has been received regarding the following summarised concerns:- Excessive height or bulk of buildings- Inappropriate design/layout- Loss of light/Sunlight- PrivacyOfficer response:The application has been assessed using BRE guidance in relation to loss of daylight/sunlight.1. Condition A.4. (7) of (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 states that where an owner or occupier of any adjoining premises objects to the proposed development, the prior approval of the local planning authority is required as to the impact of the proposed development on the amenity of any adjoining premises.2. The proposed extension would  result in an unacceptable loss of daylight/sunlight and would fail the 45 degree test with regards to daylight as set out in the Council's Residential Design SPD in relation to properties No. 197 Douglas Road.  It is therefore considered that the proposed development would have an unacceptable adverse impact on the amenities of neighbouring properties.

The site comprises detached dwelling.5 neighbouring properties have been notified of the proposals and no representations have been received. The key areas of assessment are: - The design of the proposed development; and,- The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings. When read together Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area. Officer Comment: Although the proposed flat roof design would not be subordinate to the host building's mansard roof. The proposed development is considered to be acceptable in terms of scale, form, bulk, height, massing & spacing. It is considered that there would be no adverse impacts on the character or appearance of the area as a result of the proposed development. Policy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) requires proposal to have regard to the amenities of the future occupants of the development as well as those of the existing occupants of neighbouring land and buildings, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance. Officer Comment: Given the design of the proposed development and its proximity in relation to neighbouring properties, it is considered that the proposed development would not adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of overbearing appearance, loss of light or loss of privacy. Officers note that it would accord with BRE guidelines and pass the 45 Degree Rule.In conclusion, the proposed development would be in general accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), the National Planning Practice Guidance, the London Plan (2021), Policies of the Core Strategy (2012) and the Residential Design SPD (2013).

The assessment has been based on the original layout of the house. The existing coal shed is part of the original footprint. The proposed extension would therefore extend beyond the side elevation of the original footprint and would have a width greater than half the width of the original dwellinghouse, in conflict with Paragraph A.1 (j) (iii) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The applicant is informed that the submitted details for condition 65 (Ducting Space for Full Fibre Connectivity Infrastructure) of planning permission 20/02495/FUL have been assessed and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details for condition 61 (Fire Lift Evacuation Details) of planning permission 21/04022/FUL have been assessed and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details.The submitted details comply with Policy D12 (Fire Safety) of the London Plan 2021.

An Officer has reviewed the Fire Statement submitted for condition 31 (Fire Strategy Reports) of planning permission 21/04022/FUL and the details are approved.   The submitted details comply with Policy D12 (Fire Safety) of the London Plan 2021.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details for condition 49 (Secured by Design) of planning permission  21/04022/FUL  have been assessed and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details.  The submitted security documents and reports meet the requirements of the Secured by Design (SBD) and await the formal SBD application.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details for Condition 23 (Ecological Management Plan) of planning permission  21/04022/FUL have been assessed and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details.As stated in 2.2.2 of the report the Hogsmill River (Site of Importance for Conservation) is located to the south of the site and is buffered by Lever House. So for this phase of proposed works it is considered outside the impact area of the construction zone and thus no further protection to the river is recommended. However, in future phases it will need significant consideration.Protective measures to avoid the impact of breeding birds in 2.3.1 conforms to Natural England guidance, which states that works should not be conducted during the period of 1st March to 31st August.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details for condition  63 (Air Quality Positive Statement) of planning permission 20/02495/FUL have been assessed and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details for condition 28 (Air Quality Technical Note)  of planning permission 20/02495/FUL have been assessed and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details.

SiteThe application relates to the residential unit situated on the first and second floor of a three storey building located on Park Road. The site is situated within a Controlled Parking Zone. Consultations16 neighbouring properties have been notified of the proposals and one representation was  received OBJECTING to the application on the grounds of:An increase in waste accumulation and the impact on waste and recycling. Officers acknowledge the concerns raised by neighbouring occupiers however, it is considered unlikely that an increase of one additional bedroom would result in a material increase in waste accumulation on surrounding streets and it would not be reasonable to resist the application on this basis.ConsiderationThe key areas of assessment are: The impact of the development on character and appearance. The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings.When read together Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area.Officers Comments: The proposed development is considered to be acceptable in terms of scale, form, bulk, height, massing, spacing and design. It is considered that there would be no adverse impacts on the character or appearance of the area as a result of the proposed development.Policy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) requires proposal to have regard to the amenities of the future occupants of the development as well as those of the existing occupants of neighbouring land and buildings, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance.Officers Comments: It is considered that the proposed development would not adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of overbearing appearance, loss of light or loss of privacy.In conclusion, the proposed development would be in general accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), the National Planning Practice Guidance, the London Plan (2021), Policies of the Core Strategy (2012) and the Residential Design SPD (2013).

The submitted proposed first floor plan is labelled as existing.The submitted proposed loft and roof plans are labelled as existingPlease provide proposed floor plans with correct labelling at a recognised scale (at 1:50 or 1:100 for example), showing the outline of entire floor plan, not just part and all key dimensions for the proposed works. The plans must also show the direction of North. Although the inclusion of a scale bar is not mandatory, it is encouraged.

The submitted proposed side elevations are labelled as existing.Please provide copies of proposed side elevations at a recognised scale (at 1:50 or 1:100 for example), showing all elevations not just part and indicating all key dimensions for the proposed work. Although the inclusion of a scale bar is not mandatory, it is encouraged.

The fee required for your planning application is £1,775.  Payment can be made via either our Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002, by cheque made payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames, or online via the Kingston council website - https://www.kingston.gov.uk/applications/pre-application-advice/2

The fee required for your planning application is £250.  Payment can be made via either our Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002, by cheque made payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames, or online via the Kingston council website https://www.kingston.gov.uk/applications/pre-application-advice/2
Please provide the block plan to show the distance from any landmark points/buildings to find out the exact location of the equipment on the railway track/site.

Please submit a copy of a site location plan scaled 1:1250 with the application site outlined in red and adjoining land owned by applicant in blue, showing at least two road frontages and a North point.

The fee required for your pre-planning application is £ 1,000.00.  Payment can be made via either our Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002, by cheque made payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames or online via the Kingston council website.

Further to checks by the Planning officer, I am writing to inform you that your application 23/00258/FUL is invalid.The site is in flood zone 2  and this application includes 5 new flats. Please submit a site specific detailed Flood Risk Assessment, including sequential test and details of dry escape route in flooding event. For further information and guidance please website at https://www.gov.uk/guidance/flood-risk-assessment-for-planning-applications.
Our record shows that the site does not fall in a conservation area and it does not have a TPO. Please clarify the purpose of this tree application.

Thank you for submitting revised plans and confirming this proposal is to be treated as a new application.It is noted that an 'Approved' Second Floor Plan (Plan PP-004) has been submitted. As this is a new application we require a 'Proposed' Second Floor Plan to be submitted.Please submit any further amendments to this application to the Development Management e-mail address quoted at the top of this letter, or via post, addressed to Development Management.Note: Amendments or revised drawings should not be resubmitted through the Planning Portal.

Please clarify the type of the application. The submitted email shows the discharge of condition 3, however the submitted application form is for removal or variation of condtion. Please submit the correct application form if this application is for discharge of condition. Please find the attached application forms.

We need to give your proposal a clear description. It is noted that your application fee paid was for alterations/extensions to two or more dwellings. Please can you clarify if the development proposal will result in new dwellings and the number, or if it will result in a loft conversion to be used as part of the existing house?

Issues have been noted with the following submitted plans which affect their clarity and we cannot use them to assess the application in their current form. Please check the following plans and make amendments:  KT-68VR-P-03 Proposed Floor Plans. This plan includes two Proposed First Floor Plans, and a Proposed Loft Floor Plan, but no Proposed Roof Plan. Please clarify if there should be a First Floor, Second Floor and Roof Plan, and label them correctly if so.KT-68VR-P-02 Existing Elevations - This plan includes two Existing Rear Elevation drawings. Please clarify if there should be an elevation of the front and rear, and label them correctly if so.KT-68VR-P-04 - The Plan is titled 'Proposed Floor Plans', but the drawings are Elevations. There are also two Proposed Rear Elevation drawings. Please check this plan, and re-title and label drawings correctly where necessary.Please submit any amendments to this application to the Development Management e-mail address quoted at the top of this letter, or via post, addressed to Development Management.Note: Amendments or revised drawings should not be resubmitted through the Planning Portal.

If this application is for discharge of condition (CLC), the fee required for your planning application is £ 116.00. If this application is for removal or variation of condition, the fee required for your planning application is £ 234.00. Payment can be made via either our Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002, by cheque made payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames or online via the Kingston council website.
